movie_title: Turkey protests after political rival jailed: BBC Learning English from the News
introduction: Thousands of people protest in Turkey after Erdogan's main political rival jailed üîéFor a free works

vocabulary.definition: public demonstration of objection or disapproval
vocabulary.example: The protests in Turkey have been ongoing for over a week.

vocabulary.definition: dishonest or fraudulent conduct by those in power
vocabulary.example: The mayor was arrested on charges of corruption.
His university degree was annulled, preventing him from running for election.
The EU did not condemn the action taken by Erdogan.

vocabulary.definition: a state of great disturbance, confusion, or uncertainty
vocabulary.example: Erdogan bets the world will turn a blind eye to the turmoil in Turkey.

vocabulary.definition: favoring or enforcing strict obedience to authority, at the expense of personal freedom
vocabulary.example: The writer from Jacobin believes Turkey is experiencing an authoritarian turn.
